title: NASA Celebrates Earth Day with Every #NASAEarthling
summary: NASA’s space exploration continues to inspire us to be better stewards of our planet and Earth Day is a great time to celebrate what we’ve done and can do to keep Earth everyone’s favorite planet in the universe.

title: Lockheed Martin proposes multi-layer space network for missile defense
summary: DoD is spending billions of dollars on missile-warning space sensors located in geostationary and polar orbits, but there are no plans to connect them with new constellations that DoD plans to field in low and medium Earth orbits

title: Russian cosmonauts begin spacewalk to outfit European robotic arm
summary: Two Russian cosmonauts put on their Orlan spacesuits and headed outside the International Space Station Monday for a spacewalk to begin outfitting a European robotic arm mounted on a Russian science module launched last year, a collaboration that’s been unaffected by souring international relations on Earth.

title: Cosmonauts complete spacewalk to activate space station’s European Robotic Arm
summary: Russian cosmonauts Oleg Artemyev and Denis Matveev carried out a spacewalk on April 18 to prepare the International Space Station’s new European Robotic Arm for use.

title: Mars scientists look to less expensive missions
summary: On the eve of the release of the planetary science decadal survey likely to place a decreased emphasis on Mars, scientists and NASA officials are planning how to continue exploration of the planet with less expensive missions.

title: NASA asks SpaceX to decide the fate of ‘Dragon XL’ lunar cargo spacecraft
summary: In a new Request For Information (RFI) quietly released by NASA on April Fools’ Day, the space agency appears to have indirectly...

title: Seeking growth in unpredictable times: A conversation with SES CEO Steve Collar
summary: SpaceNews spoke with SES CEO Steve Collar about how the industry is weathering shifting schedules as geopolitical issues add more complexities for the year ahead.

title: COMSPOC executive to join DoD space policy office
summary: Travis Langster, vice president and general manager of COMSPOC, will be leaving the company to join the Defense Department as principal director of DoD space policy

title: SpaceX reuses Falcon 9 booster for second spy satellite launch in two months
summary: Using the same Falcon 9 booster, SpaceX has successfully completed its second National Reconnaissance Office (NRO) spy satellite launch in a little...

title: SpaceX launches and lands rocket National Reconnaissance Office mission
summary: SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket with a classified payload at dawn Sunday for the National Reconnaissance Office, the U.S. government’s spy satellite agency, and landed the booster stage back at Vandenberg Space Force Base.
